item.title: Hit by blackouts Cuba’s tourism industry now braces for Trump
item.description: Cuba's hotels, already hit by power cuts, worry that Trump may increase the US's economic blockade.

item.title: Reports of people trapped underground at notorious Syrian prison
item.description: It is thought thousands of people could still be trapped in hidden parts of the notorious Saydnaya prison.

item.title: South Korea orders travel ban for President Yoon
item.description: The decision to hand power to the country's prime minister has been widely criticised by the opposition.

item.title: Melbourne synagogue fire 'likely' terror act, police say
item.description: Three suspects are being sought over the fire, which injured one person and caused extensive damage.

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot lifts her sunglasses and chooses to fight back
item.description: The woman at the centre of the mass rape case sees her public trial as a chance to "stand for all victims".
